intro: Luzula banksiana var. migrata, commonly known as the migratory woodrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Plantaginaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and compact, spike-like inflorescences that bear small, white to greenish flowers. Native to northern regions of North America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and wetlands. The plant has fibrous roots and exhibits a clump-forming growth habit, often forming dense mats. Its leaves are typically narrow, linear, and have a bluish-green hue, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
